extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Full head of cauliflower, cut into flourets

extendedIngredients.name: cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups good cheese (I used Gruyere, some swiss, maybe a bit of cheddar.)
metaInformation: (I used Gruyere, some swiss, maybe a bit of cheddar.)

extendedIngredients.name: sour cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Sour cream (or Greek Yogurt. The original calls for Creme fraiche which is nice if you can get it).
metaInformation: for creme fraiche which is nice if you can get it).

recipes.title: Cauliflower Macaroni and Cheese

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. The Molo 8 Lambrusco Mantovano with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Molo 8 Lambrusco Mantovano
productMatches.description: Intense ruby red. The bouquet is persistent and fragrant with hints of black cherries and wild berries. On the palate the wine is aromatic, fruity and pleasantly sweet.Ideal for cheese, ham, salami, pork or cold cuts and most dishes.

recipes.instructions: Directions1) Boil your cut up cauliflower in a large pot of salted water for 3 minutes, until tender but still crisp. Pull out your cauliflower, but keep the water to make the pasta in!2) Melt 2 TBSP. butter in large saut pan over medium-high heat. Saut cauliflower for five minutes. Add tomatoes and onions. Cook for a few minutes just to combine all the yummy flavors.3) In a separate pan, make your Roux by melting 2 TBSP. butter and whisking in 2 TBSP. flour. Cook for a few minutes and then slowly add in your cream and milk. The mixture will thicken pretty quickly.4) Add your cheese slowly until it is all melted, then sour cream or creme fraiche, 1/2 of your Parm, and mustard. Season with Salt and pepper and remove from heat once it is thick and cheesy and awesome.5) Cook your pasta in the cauliflower water. Drain the water.6) Add your cauliflower mixture to the pasta and pour sauce over it. Combine well.7) Pour into a buttered 13X9 baking dish.8 ) Top with breadcrumbs and the rest of your Parm.9) Bake at 350 for 40 minutes until golden brown.

Pour into a buttered 13X9 baking dish.8 ) Top with breadcrumbs and the rest of your Parm.9)
